uk.ac.susx.mlcl.lib.test
Class ExitTrapper

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.susx.mlcl.lib.test.ExitTrapper

public class ExitTrapper
extends Object

Static utility class that allows calls to System.exit(int) to be intercepted. This makes direct testing of main methods possible, since all calls to System.exit(int) result in a runtime ExitTrapper.ExitException, rather than simply terminating the forked VM (passing the test).

When exit trapping is enabled, the previously installed SecurityManager will be temporarily encapsulate, over-riding SecurityManager.checkExit(int). It will pass all other security related checks to the encapsulated security manager (if there was one). When trapping is disabled the previously installed manager will be re-instated.

Take care that there are guarantees in place to insure ExitTrapper is disabled when not required, otherwise it's functionality will bleed into other area of VM. To insure ExitTrapper is disabled enclosed it in a try/finally block:

  try {
      ExitTrapper.enableExistTrapping();

      // Do trapped stuff here...

  } catch(ExitException ex) {
      // System.exit() was called
      int status = ex.getStatus();
      // Handle exception here
  }finally {
      ExitTrapper.disableExitTrapping();
  }

Author:
Hamish Morgan <hamish.morgan@sussex.ac.uk>

Nested Class Summary
static class ExitTrapper.ExitException
          ExitException is a SecurityException that will be thrown when System.exit(int) is called and trapping is enabled.
 
Method Summary
static void disableExitTrapping()
          Turn off exit trapping if it's currently on
static void enableExistTrapping()
          Turn on exit trapping if it's currently off
static boolean isExitTrappingEnabled()
          Return whether or not exit trapping is enabled.
static void toggleExitTrapping()
          Turn off exit trapping if it's currently on, otherwise turn it on
